title: Sagmeister Typeface
content:
anyone know the Sagmeister typeface for his new book, Things I Have Learned in My Life So Far?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Snapshot 2008-03-11 15-03-39.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133450/http:/typophile.com/files/Snapshot%202008-03-11%2015-03-39.jpg) | 36.1 KB |

 [‹ Electric Rock Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133450/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43065 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looks like Kuenstler, but not quite ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133450/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43058 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Garrrettt

comments.content: [Lutz Headline](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133450/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Latest+Releases/Lutz+Headline/) is very similar. Perhaps they are based on the same source: UK car plates.

Lineto [says](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133450/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Latest+Releases/Lutz+Headline/About+this+Font/) that Lutz has two cap styles, but I don’t see that reflected in their [character set](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202133450/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Latest+Releases/Lutz+Headline/Character+Map/). You might email them and ask.
Yes, a few of the glyphs are different. That’s why I say “similar”.
